title: So... about React Time vs Assassin.

replies.body: The reaction time is him activating his ult. You have more than enough time to react to him activating his ult and him assassinating you

There's plenty of ways a decent rengar can reduce that reaction time by a considerable amount.


The most common used method  being oracles+ ghostblade for movement speed increase + lack of vision of where he may have started ulting from assuming the area was warded anyways.
yes, lets ignore the likely 30 to 60 seconds you had where his ulti let you know he could see you, and therefore you had 30 to 60 seconds to run away.

> [{quoted}](name=ChaddyFantome,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dcc8ndAU,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-01-01T07:02:05.229+0000)
>
> yes, lets ignore the likely 30 to 60 seconds you had where his ulti let you know he could see you, and therefore you had 30 to 60 seconds to run away.

haha good joke.

Does that include how most rengars more than likely have multiple forms of movement speed increase?

As well as you assuming he's only ulting from a distance.

Why would he use his ulti at melee range?

To BM?

If he is that close, he wouldnt even use it as he is perfectly capable of getting on you as is in that scenario.

No, There can be a case when someone is on the otherside of the wall, a rengar can press R and it's a free wall hop.

Another case can be a mental game... Ok rengar ulted, how far away did he ult from(unknown), which direction could he be coming from(unknown)

> [{quoted}](name=A Bloo Banana,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dcc8ndAU,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2017-01-02T12:31:35.720+0000)
>
> No, There can be a case when someone is on the otherside of the wall, a rengar can press R and it's a free wall hop.
I say this as someone who despises Rengar. Always have. he is my most hated champ in the history of league. Always has been and will continue to be. But I will give Riot this much in that new Rengar is WAY more tolerable than he has ever been.

I'll stick to my assertion that if he is that close to you to begin with, you are probs positioning badly anyway.

Only walls i can thin of where this can realistically be useful is Baron and dragon pits, in which case, i have to wonder what you are doing in the back of them.

other areas like blue and red pit  and the ledge in the rivers already have bushes all around them for him to get to you, and therefor him being able to get to u from those points doesn't even require his ulti, which makes it a question of your positioning.


> Another case can be a mental game... Ok rengar ulted, how far away did he ult from(unknown), which direction could he be coming from(unknown)

That's... pretty much the entire point of his ultimate. And lucky for you, most Rengars don't even utilize this aspect of it.

It doesn't matter tho. What matters is if he can see you with it, he is coming for you, and it is in your prerogative to hide behind Teammates or run for cover as soon as you notice he is coming for you.

It doesn't mater if he is at base when he ultis or in the river. Don't take your sweet time thinking. "oh he wont reach me for a good 30 seconds, i can chill for now". That's the fools move and how all morons die in monster movies.

Never make decisions based on info you don't have unless you have enough reason to make the educated guess.
thanks god rengar can still assassinate people with a ful ad build
If I was 0/20 vs a 30/1 rengar, I'd die in 0.3 seconds too...
